title: The Neverending Dream
opening: After obtaining the Binding Blade, Roy led the Etrurian Army to Castle Bern, where King Zephiel was waiting.
Zephiel, the man responsible for starting this war…
Inside the castle, Zephiel awaited with his personal guards by his side.
Roy prepared to charge the castle. To end this war, and to bring peace to Elibe again…

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: So... Murdock was defeated...

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: ...I am sorry.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: ...How is the Etrurian Army behaving?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: They have captured the Temple of Seals. They are currently headed this way.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: I see... Then we shall face them inside this castle.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Yes. I will protect you to the death, your Majesty.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: No. Brunnya, I have a very important task for you.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: What...?

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Idunn. Where is Idunn?

intro.speaker: Idunn
intro.line: ...Here, your Majesty.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: I will stay here and defend the castle from the Etrurian Army. Idunn, you must escape and hide until this battle is over.

intro.speaker: Idunn
intro.line: If his Majesty wishes.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Brunnya, I want you to escape as well. Protect Idunn.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: What!? Please! Let me fight by your side!

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: No. ...This will be a harsh battle. I cannot afford to lose Idunn now. If Idunn were lost...this whole war would be meaningless.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: But! I, I...!

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Enough, Brunnya! This is an order. Are you telling me that you cannot follow your king’s commands?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: No... I’m not saying that...

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Idunn, even if I fall... I trust you understand.

intro.speaker: Idunn
intro.line: Yes... I will free the world, as you commanded.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Right. I will not give up my dream now.

intro.speaker: Idunn
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Hero
intro.line: The Etrurian Army has come... I will not let you invade the throne room!

intro.speaker: Hero
intro.line: I shall protect this device with my life!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: This is the king’s castle...

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Master Roy, Zephiel is residing in the throne room at the center of the castle. However, there seem to be some special devices that protect the throne room when invaders appear.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: What kind of devices?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: One of the captives said that at the west end of the castle, there are switches that need to pulled before one can access the throne room.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: It’ll be a long detour...

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: There is more. After hitting the switches, you must hold the ‘Gem’ in front of the throne room door to make it open.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Gem? Is it the Fire Emblem?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Most likely.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I have that with me. So I should head to the throne room while leaving the switches to the others...

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: That would be the shortest way.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: ...But would the captives leak that kind of information so easily? Perhaps it’s a trap...

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: I doubt it, Master Roy. The captive also said, ‘The switches and the door are all defended by Bern’s most powerful warriors. You wouldn’t be able to get to the throne room even if you knew how.'

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: We need to try, even if we’re going up against powerful enemies. We’ve gotten strong as well. We won’t lose!

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: So, you have come. Hmph...how ironic. A child, stepping in my path.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Zephiel...King of Bern... I will ask you this. Why did you start this war?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: ...I wish to end the age of men.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: ...What?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Humans... Humans are filthy. They flock to those with power and would not think twice about betraying trusted allies to obtain more power. You must have witnessed numerous traitors in your travels. Am I right?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Jealousy. Hate. Greed. Friends, even family members are driven to kill by such ludicrous emotions. Such emotions create fathers who try to kill their own sons to save their own flesh. As long as humans control, as long as humans dictate, as long as humans exist...this madness will never end.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: But look at what you are doing! You are one of those humans who control others!

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: ...You know how the Scouring ended.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: The Dark Dragon was defeated by Hartmut...

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: That was the mistake.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Mistake?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Mankind should not have won. Just because the humans came out victorious, this world came under their control, and transformed into a world of madness and evil, driven by accursed emotions!

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Mistakes must be fixed with haste. I will give the world back to the Dragons. I will free the world from the evil grasp of men. History must be redone from the beginning to save this world from everlasting evil!

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Then...it is true that you resurrected the Dark Dragon.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: You may see that for yourself.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: You said you would give the world to the Dragons. Then rule by humans would just be replaced by similar rule by Dragons!

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: The Dragons you see now are weapons for battle. They have no ‘self.’ They have no cruel emotions to be driven by, unlike foolish humans. The world under the Dragons’ control would be fair and peaceful.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: I cannot agree that such a world would be for the better good! It is true that humans have many evil emotions and do terrible things, but it has always been us humans who have corrected such wrongdoings!

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Hmph...you are indeed naive.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: I have faith in mankind. I will not lose to a man who has lost faith in his people and even in himself!

boss.speaker: Zephiel
boss.line: You shall not bar my path!

boss.speaker: Zephiel
boss.line: …So, you have defeated me… But remember… My dream shall never die… As long as…humans retain control…madness will persist…

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Zephiel...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...Princess Guinevere.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: I’m sorry... Please leave me alone for a while...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess...!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy... We should let her be.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: ...Allow me.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Elffin!

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...Thank you. I knew you had your own problems with your own nation... But you helped us. I must thank you...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: ...I don’t quite understand what you mean...but if I have been helpful, then you are most welcome.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...Control over humans by humans...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Zephiel’s words? Perhaps he was right...in a way.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...Has the Dark Priestess been found?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: No... Apparently she disappeared before the battle.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I see... Do you think she’s really the Dark Dragon?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: I wouldn’t know unless I actually saw her. It’s going to be difficult to find her because she is said to clad in a black robe, and no one has ever seen her up close.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Oh... But the battle is now over.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: What are you saying, Master Roy! The hard part has yet to come. We must help the land recover from the war. There are people out there who need our assistance.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Right! We have work to do. The real battle may be just beginning.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Yes. We are alive, so we must think about the future.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: No matter what hardships are to come, I will never give up. We have to show that even humans can construct a beautiful and peaceful world!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy, you will have me at your side, always. Now, let us leave the castle for now. We must spread the word of victory!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: The king of Bern is finished...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: We’ve done it, Master Roy.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: ...Perhaps it is a bit early to rejoice.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: We still haven’t found the Dark Priestess yet.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Hm, perchance she escaped?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Wh-What is happening!?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Zephiel’s sword just flashed! What was its name...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Exaccus... A sword that can only be used by the heirs to Bern’s throne...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: W-Wait! One of the legends of the Scouring said... When all of the Divine Weapons meet in one place, thus appears the Dragon Temple...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Dragon Temple...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: It was the Dragons’ headquarters during the Scouring, I believe.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Yes, that is what the legends say.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Then the Exaccus was the last Divine Weapon? I thought Hartmut’s sword was the Binding Blade.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: ...The Binding Blade may be different. Perhaps it is even more powerful than the Divine Weapons...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: More powerful...? What kind of power does this blade possess...?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy! The sword is glowing again! Look, a beam of light is pointing to the south!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Does this mean that the Dragon Temple is located where this light is pointing?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: If the legends are true, then I would assume that as well.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: ...If the Dark Priestess is indeed the Dark Dragon... There is a high chance that she is there.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: All right! Let’s go to the Dragon Temple!

narration: And thus, the battle known later as the Great Movement of Bern was resolved.
With Zephiel’s death, Bern surrendered to Etruria. Etruria dismantled its government, but after careful consideration, avoided directly administering its reconstruction.

With Roy’s help, Guinevere took the throne and the New Kingdom of Bern was established. Many of the nobles of Bern expressed their discontent at Guinevere handing over the Fire Emblem to the former enemy, but with her efforts and hard work, she cut open a new path of recovery for Bern.
While the Dark Priestess was never found, peace was restored, and Elibe was set for a new age of prosperity led by Etruria.
Elibe regained its former peace and balance. Centuries after Roy’s time, the nations in Elibe were united under a single flag, but that is another story for another time…
